definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn

sentences.english: He is, as it were , a walking dictionary.
Mr. Johnson was known as a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生被称作一本活字典。

sentences.english: He is often lovingly termed a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 他常被亲切地称为活字典。

sentences.english: She is, as it were, a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 她可以说是一部活字典。

sentences.english: The girl has an unusually large vocabulary and is known as a "walking dictionary".
sentences.chinese: 那女孩知道的词真多，被称为“活字典”。

sentences.english: She knows so many words that she's a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 她知道这么多单词，是部活字典。

sentences.english: He is what we call walking dictionary.
Why he was known as a walking dictionary it?
sentences.chinese: 为什么他被称作为一本活字典呢？

sentences.english: He is, as it were, a walking dictionary.
He is, as it were, a walking dictionary .
He doesn't need any dictionary, because he is a walking dictionary himself.
sentences.chinese: 他不需要什么字典，因为他本身就是一本活字典。

sentences.english: He is what is called a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 他就是人们所谓的一本活字典。

sentences.english: He is, so to speak, a walking dictionary.
He really lives up to his reputation as “a walking dictionary”.
sentences.chinese: 他真是名副其实的“活字典”。

definition: lit. as if enumerating one's family valuables (idiom)/fig. to be very familiar with a matter
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
have wide learning and a retentive memory/have encyclopedic knowledge
China watcher/an expert on China/an old China hand
(abbr. for 泰山北斗[Tai4 Shan1 Bei3 dou3]) distinguished figure/doyen/revered authority
to honor sb as a God (idiom); to revere/to worship/to deify/to make a holy cow of sth/to put sb on a pedestal
proficient (in sth)/to understand sth through and through
